s.text: 4. "GE CEO Jack Welch announced that he will retire after the company's annual meeting in April 2001, meaning that all eyes will be focused on his succession . Early suggestions for ways of whittling down the list of contenders include: two weeks of Navy SEAL training (if you ring the bell, you're out); a bake-off using GE's cool new photo-light oven; and a gala tourney of Win Ben Stein's Money ."

1. "The Justice Department recommended that Bell Atlantic's application to offer long-distance service to its local customers be denied, saying the company had come close to opening its local networks sufficiently to competitors, but that its efforts fell just short . An initial draft of the memo was reportedly titled 'Only In Horseshoes and Hand Grenades.
'Paw, the fed funds rate just jumped again.

3. "After the Nasdaq toyed with the 3,000 level on Tuesday before closing just below it, technical traders came out of the woodwork to say that breaking through 3,000 was going to be tough, because it was a 'resistance level' for the index.
